title: Serializable object
summary:
Serializable objects are objects that can be serialized and later deserialized in any JavaScript environment ("realm").
  This allows them to, for example, be stored on disk and later restored, or cloned with structuredClone(), or shared between workers using DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope.postMessage().

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
